page.title: 18BANCHORY-DEVENICK WILDLIFE 1
page.content: There is a great amount of wild plants etc and animals in Banchory- Devenick. Wherever you go you are likely to see a{forest, wood or stretch of moorland around you. Most of the moorland has been cultivated by the farmers. { Rabbits}are common but occasionally {hare, hedgehog or weasel}are seen. { Deer}still follow their ancient paths irrespective of new roads, houses and fences. The{fox}population is quite high although rarely seen in day-time. Recently a fox killed a pet pea-cock. The{birds}you are most likely to see are{magpies and crows}but there are many little hedgerow birds like{tits, {sparrows, blackbirds and finches. { Herons}are down by the River Dee and because the area is quite near the sea, many{seagulls}flock here especially when the farmers are ploughing or seeding.
